member.name: P:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfigurationBase.UseLowercaseRoutes
member.summary: When true, the generated routes will produce lowercase URLs. The default is false.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfigurationBase.PreserveCaseForUrlParameters
member.summary: When true, the generated routes will not lowercase URL parameter values. The default is false.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfigurationBase.AppendTrailingSlash
member.summary: When true, the generated routes will have a trailing slash on the path of outbound URLs. The default is false.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfigurationBase.AutoGenerateRouteNames
member.summary: When true, the generated routes will have auto-generated route names in the form controller_action. The default is false.

member.name: T:AttributeRouting.Framework.AttributeRouteExtensions
member.summary: Shared logic for use in implementations of .
member.remarks: Due to different route implementations in System.Web.Routing (used for mvc controller routes), System.Web.Http.Routing (used for self-hosted api controller routes), and System.Web.Http.WebHost.Routing (used for web-hosted api controller routes).

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.Framework.AttributeRouteExtensions.IsLeftPartOfUrlMatched(AttributeRouting.Framework.IAttributeRoute,System.String)
member.summary: Optimizes route matching by comparing the static left part of a route's URL with the requested path.
member.param: The path of the requested URL.
member.returns: True if the requested URL path starts with the static left part of the route's URL.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.Framework.AttributeRouteExtensions.IsSubdomainMatched(AttributeRouting.Framework.IAttributeRoute,System.String,AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfigurationBase)
member.summary: Tests whether the configured subdomain (if any) matches the current host.
member.param: The host from the current request
The configuration for the route
member.returns: True if the subdomain for this route matches the current request host.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.Framework.AttributeRouteExtensions.IsCultureNameMatched(AttributeRouting.Framework.IAttributeRoute,System.String,AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfigurationBase)
member.summary: Tests whether the route matches the current UI culture.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.Framework.AttributeRouteExtensions.GetTranslatedVirtualPath``1(AttributeRouting.Framework.IAttributeRoute,System.Func{AttributeRouting.Framework.IAttributeRoute,``0})
member.summary: Gets the translated virtual path for this route.
member.typeparam: The type of virtual path data to be returned. This varies based on whether the route is a System.Web.Routing.Route or System.Web.Http.Routing.HttpRoute.
member.param: A delegate that can get the TVirtualPathData from a translated route
member.returns: Returns null if no translation is available.

member.name: M:AttributeRouting.Framework.AttributeRouteExtensions.GetFinalVirtualPath(AttributeRouting.Framework.IAttributeRoute,System.String,AttributeRouting.AttributeRoutingConfigurationBase)
member.summary: Performs lowercasing and appends trailing slash if this route is so configured.
member.param: The current virtual path, after translation
The configuration for the route

member.name: T:AttributeRouting.Framework.Factories.IAttributeRouteFactory

member.summary: Create a new attribute route that wraps an underlying framework route.

member.summary: Yields all the routes to register in the route table.

member.name: T:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute
member.remarks: Implementors MUST disambiguate among routes based on the HttpMethods allowed for this route. In System.Web.Mvc, that means deriving from ActionMethodSelectorAttribute. In System.Web.Http, that means deriving from IActionHttpMethodProvider.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.RouteUrl
member.summary: The url for this action.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.HttpMethods
member.summary: The HttpMethods this route is constrained against.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.Order
member.summary: The order of this route among all the routes defined against this action.
member.remarks: Zero and Positive integers denote top routes: 1 is first, 2 is second, etc.... Negative integers denote bottom routes: -1 is last, -2 is second to last, etc....

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.ActionPrecedence
member.summary: The order of this route among all the routes defined against this action.
member.remarks: Positive integers (including zero) denote top routes: 1 is first, 2 is second, etc.... Negative integers denote bottom routes: -1 is last, -2 is second to last, etc....

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.Precedence
member.summary: The order of this route among all the routes defined against this controller.
member.remarks: Positive integers (including zero) denote top routes: 1 is first, 2 is second, etc.... Negative integers denote bottom routes: -1 is last, -2 is second to last, etc....

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.ControllerPrecedence
member.summary: The order of this route among all the routes defined against this controller.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.SitePrecedence
member.summary: The order of this route among all the routes in the site.
member.remarks: Positive integers (including zero) denote top routes: 1 is first, 2 is second, etc.... Negative integers denote bottom routes: -1 is last, -2 is second to last, etc....

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.RouteName
member.summary: The name this route will be registered with in the RouteTable.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.IsAbsoluteUrl
member.summary: If true, the generated route url will be applied from the root, skipping any relevant area name or route prefix.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.TranslationKey
member.summary: Key used by translation provider to lookup the translation for the .

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.UseLowercaseRoute
member.summary: If set, will override set via global configuration for this route.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.UseLowercaseRouteFlag
member.summary: Gets the tri-state value for UseLowercaseRoutes.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.PreserveCaseForUrlParameters
member.summary: If set, will override set via global configuration for this route.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.PreserveCaseForUrlParametersFlag
member.summary: Gets the tri-state value for PreserveCaseForUrlParameters.

member.summary: If true, will override set via global configuration for this route.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.IRouteAttribute.AppendTrailingSlashFlag

member.name: T:AttributeRouting.Framework.RouteNameBuilders
member.summary: Route name builders for generating conventional route names.

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.Framework.RouteNameBuilders.Unique
member.summary: This builder ensures that every route has a unique name. Preferably, it generates routes names like "Area_Controller_Action". In case of duplicates, it will append the HTTP method (if not a GET route) and/or a unique index to the route. So the most heinous possible form is "Area_Controller_Action_Method_Index".

member.name: P:AttributeRouting.Framework.RouteNameBuilders.FirstInWins
member.summary: This builder generates routes in the form "Area_Controller_Action". In case of duplicates, the duplicate route is not named, and the builder will return null.
